message.content:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: 
// Write highscores to file at gameover
if(gameOver == true){
    sbg.enterState(5, new FadeOutTransition(), new FadeInTransition());
    if(score > Highscores.highscore3 && score < Highscores.highscore2){
        Highscores.highscore3 = score;
    }else if(score > Highscores.highscore2 && score < Highscores.highscore1){
        Highscores.highscore3 = Highscores.highscore2;
        Highscores.highscore2 = score;
    }else if(score > Highscores.highscore1){
        Highscores.highscore3 = Highscores.highscore2;
        Highscores.highscore2 = Highscores.highscore1;
        Highscores.highscore1 = score;
    }else Highscores.highscore1 = score;

    //Write highscores to highscores.txt
    try{
        File save = new File("highscores.txt");
        if (!save.exists()){
            save.createNewFile();
            System.out.println("\n----------------------------------");
            System.out.println("The file has been created.");
            System.out.println("------------------------------------");
        }
        PrintWriter writer = new PrintWriter(new FileOutputStream(save, true), "UTF-8");
        writer.write(String.valueOf(Highscores.highscore1) + "\n");
        writer.write(String.valueOf(Highscores.highscore2) + "\n");
        writer.write(String.valueOf(Highscores.highscore3) + "\n");
        writer.close();
    }catch(Exception e){
        e.printStackTrace();
    }
    gameOver = false;
    gameStart = false;
}

// Read highscores from highscores.txt at program start
public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException{
    BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("highscores.txt"));
    String line;
    while((line = in.readLine()) != null){
        System.out.println(line);
    }
    in.close();
}
<<<explanation>>>: In the code, we first check if the file "highscores.txt" exists. If it doesn't, we create it using the createNewFile() method. Then, we use PrintWriter to write the high scores to the file. The FileOutputStream is used with the parameter 'true' to append the data to the existing file. The write() method of PrintWriter is used to write the high scores to the file. Each high score is written on a new line. The BufferedReader is used to read the high scores from the file at the start of the program.

Question: How can I calculate the sum of an array in Java?
Please using this api: Arrays.stream.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Arrays.stream
<<<code>>>: int[] array = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
int sum = Arrays.stream(array).sum();
<<<explanation>>>: The sum() method of the IntStream class returns the sum of elements in this stream. This is a special case of a reduction. This is a terminal operation.

Please using this api: PrintWriter.write.
